main event: On July 18, 1949, at Fairfield-Suisun Air Force Base in California, two dull white or silver colored objects were observed traveling at a very high rate of speed in an easterly direction. The objects were visible for 4-5 seconds and seemed to disappear. No sound, smoke, exhaust, or trail was observed.
interesting points: The objects were observed for only 4-5 seconds before disappearing, indicating a brief and sudden appearance.
They were traveling at a very high rate of speed, as fast or faster than a C-82 aircraft that was in the same vicinity.
No sound, smoke, exhaust, or trail was observed, suggesting that the objects had unusual propulsion or were not conventional aircraft.
The shape of the objects was described as round, and their color as dull white or silver, displaying typical 'flying saucer' characteristics.
The altitude of the objects was estimated to be between 5000-6000 feet, indicating high altitude travel.
sighted object: two dull white or silver colored objects
